Welcome to "States & Capitals", a game that allows you to test your knowledge of the US States and Capitals. 

To Play: 

To begin, enter your name and press the "Play Game!" button. 

A state or capital will be appear on the screen, and you must provide the corresponding state or capital that matches. To answer, type your answer in the text field (A light grey text will tell you which to enter). As you type, word suggestions will be provided in case you don't know the exact spelling of a state or capital. After you have entered your answer, press the "Submit" button to find out if your answer was right or wrong. If you guess wrong, the correct answer will be displayed so that you can learn as you play. The next question will then load. Once you have guessed all 50 states and capitals, the game is over, and you will be taken to the score page, with your name and score selected in yellow. To play again, pressed the "back" button on your device to return to the main start screen. 

State/Capital Mode: 

At any point in the game, you can select which you would like to guess, a state or a capital, by clicking on the blue "State/Capital" button in the upper left hand corner of the screen. When you press this button, the current question will be skipped, and a new question with the desired mode, will be displayed. The light grey text in the text field will update to remind you which mode you are in. If you are in state mode, a blurry image of the USA with a question mark will displayed, and if you are in capital mode, an image of the current state will be displayed. 

Scores: 

You can keep track of your score by looking at the blue "Score:" box, which is located in the upper right hand corner of the screen. If your score averages to 80% or above, the score will be displayed in green, if your score is 60% or above, it will be displayed in orange, and if your score falls below 60%, it will be displayed in red. 

Score Page: 

Before you start the game, you can click on the "Scores" button to view the scores of the people that have played before. Use this to keep track of your progress, or to find a high score to attempt to beat! You will always be taken to the score page when you finish the game, and your current score will be highlighted in yellow. 

We hope you enjoy the game, and that it provides you with a chance to solidify your knowledge of the nation's states and capitals!
